subject: RE: [junit] Native Code and JUnit

messageBody:
hi markus
Here is the snippet code for u

Junit Program
--------------

private HelloWorld instance;

public void setUp() {
if (instance == null) {
instance = new Helloworld();
}
}

Program which loads native library
-----------------------------------
Helloworld.java

static{
loadLibrary();
}

private static void loadLibrary(){
System.loadLibrary("nativeLibrary");
}

I hope this will work bcoz this tested code .The setup
method will be automatically called everytime ,when ever
there is test method to be executed.

Bala

From: sachin gupta

Subject: RE: [junit] Native Code and JUnit

setup is run befor every test. You might add a static block that does
this
library loading.

-----Original Message-----
From: Markus Kohler [mailto:kohler@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 25, 2001 5:47 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Native Code and JUnit


Hi,
I'm trying to test some Java code that uses JNI to access some native
Windows NT functions.
I'm running into trouble when loading the library.
When running the test using the swing GUI it works only every second
time.
The problem is that it claims that the library (dll) is already loaded.

For loading the dll I added the line
System.loadLibrary("myLib");

to setup()

Does anybody know how to detect that the library is loaded ?

Regards,
Markus
